result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Audrey M. Faivre

records.addlTxt:
Attorney  Ryan Drengler in court for Defendant Audrey M Faivre. Prosecuting Atty Daniel R. Hess appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Audrey M Faivre appeared by phone. Attorney  Daniel R. Hess in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Cases 13CM559, 15CM432, and 15CM15, and 5 Uncharged Read Ins. 
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Defendant is in voluntary treatment.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

State has complied with victim notification.
Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CM559

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 13CM559.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CM432 and 15CM15 are dismissed and read in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2017 at 10:15 am.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Ryan Drengler
Pre-trial conference on October 2, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Audrey M. Faivre appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-15, 13CM-559 and 15CM-432.

11:56 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, Defendant failed to appear at the plea/sentencing hearing in January 2016.

Court questions Defendant as to non appearance.
Defendant replies. 
Defendant returned to Wisconsin about a week ago. 

Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding bond.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders $1,000 cash bond, covers all 3 files.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2017 at 11:00 am.
filed by Atty Anne Renc and dated 03/23/17 in re:   representation of the defendant has been terminated

ADA Constable states appearance.
State requests a body only state wide warrant on defendant's non appearance.

BTC:
Court issues a Statewide Body Only Warrant.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-14-2016 11:30 am
